## Overview

The templates folder contains **structured documentation templates** for CreativeWorkzStudio LLC. These aren't simple fill-in-the-blank forms - they're **thinking tools** that guide you through Kingdom Technology principles while creating documentation.

> [!IMPORTANT]
> **Templates ‚â† Fill-in-the-blanks.** These templates include embedded thinking guidance to help you apply Kingdom Technology standards intentionally, not mechanically.

**What's included:**

| Icon | Template | Purpose | Use For |
|:----:|----------|---------|---------|
| üìÑ | **TEMPLATE-G-001** | Standard document structure | Standards, patterns, guides, references |
| üìö | **TEMPLATE-T-000** | Main INDEX structure | Root-level INDEX.md files |
| üìÇ | **TEMPLATE-T-001** | Category INDEX structure | Division/folder-level INDEX.md files |
| üíª | **CODE-GO-001** | Go executable template | Entry point programs (`package main`) |
| üíª | **CODE-GO-002** | Go library template | Reusable library packages |
| üíª | **CODE-GO-003** | Go demo-test template | Demonstration-based test files |
| üîß | **CODE-MAKE-001** | Make project template | Project-level Makefiles |
| üîß | **CODE-CMAKE-001** | CMake project template | Project-level CMakeLists.txt |

All templates follow Kingdom Technology standards and demonstrate the [4-block structure](../standards/CWS-STD-001-DOC-4-block.md).

---

## What Makes These Different

**Traditional templates:**

- Fill in the blanks
- Copy-paste structure
- Follow format mechanically

**Kingdom Technology templates:**

- Guide your thinking
- Apply principles intentionally
- Serve people at all levels
- Demonstrate excellence

**Key features:**

| Feature | How It Works | Why It Matters |
|---------|--------------|----------------|
| **Thinking guidance** | `<!-- THINKING: -->` comments throughout | Helps you apply principles, not just structure |
| **4-block structure** | METADATA ‚Üí SETUP ‚Üí BODY ‚Üí CLOSING | Intentional design, forces clarity |
| **Placeholder clarity** | `[BRACKETS]` mark what needs replacing | No ambiguity about what's template vs content |
| **Embedded standards** | CWS-STD-001/002/003 patterns built-in | Compliance by design |
| **Serving all levels** | Guidance for starting ‚Üí advanced users | Nobody blocked by understanding level |

> [!TIP]
> **Read the thinking comments.** They're not clutter - they're embedded wisdom guiding your decisions as you create documentation.

---

## Available Templates

### üìÑ TEMPLATE-G-001-DOC-standard-document.md

**General-purpose documentation template**

**Use for:** Standards, patterns, guides, references, any formal documentation

**Structure:**

- METADATA block (identity, purpose, authors, status)
- SETUP block (overview, context, what readers need first)
- BODY block (core content, organized by section)
- CLOSING block (quick reference, biblical foundation, footer)

**Key features:**

- Embedded thinking guidance throughout
- 4-block structure enforced
- Document keying placeholder (CWS-STD-002)
- Alert boxes and formatting patterns
- TOC structure
- Professional footer

**When to use:**

- Creating new standards
- Writing guides or patterns
- Documenting systems or processes
- Any formal documentation needing structure

**File:** [`TEMPLATE-G-001-DOC-standard-document.md`](TEMPLATE-G-001-DOC-standard-document.md)

---

### üìö TEMPLATE-T-000-INDEX-main.md

**Main INDEX.md template for root-level navigation**

**Use for:** Root-level INDEX.md files providing comprehensive workspace navigation

**Structure:**

- Comprehensive navigation by category
- Links to all major documentation
- Status indicators for projects
- Quick reference sections
- Master table of contents

**Key features:**

- Hierarchical organization
- Multiple navigation paths
- Status tracking integration
- Cross-references to all divisions
- Quick command reference

**When to use:**

- Creating root-level INDEX.md
- Comprehensive workspace navigation
- Master documentation hub
- Top-level entry points

**File:** [`TEMPLATE-T-000-INDEX-main.md`](TEMPLATE-T-000-INDEX-main.md)

---

### üìÇ TEMPLATE-T-001-INDEX-category.md

**Category INDEX.md template for division/folder navigation**

**Use for:** Division or folder-level INDEX.md files providing focused navigation

**Structure:**

- Focused navigation within scope
- Links to parent documentation
- Links to child documentation
- Category-specific quick reference
- Relevant cross-references

**Key features:**

- Scoped to specific category
- Parent/child navigation clear
- Category-appropriate organization
- Relevant quick commands
- Focused cross-references

**When to use:**

- Creating division-level INDEX.md
- Folder-specific navigation
- Scoped documentation hubs
- Category entry points

**File:** [`TEMPLATE-T-001-INDEX-category.md`](TEMPLATE-T-001-INDEX-category.md)

---

### üíª Code Templates (CODE-GO-*)

**Go code file templates with full 4-block structure**

**Use for:** Go executables, libraries, and demo-test files following Kingdom Technology standards

**Available templates:**

| Template | Purpose | Use For |
|----------|---------|---------|
| **CODE-GO-001** | Go Executable | Entry point programs (`package main`) |
| **CODE-GO-002** | Go Library | Reusable library packages |
| **CODE-GO-003** | Go Demo-Test | Demonstration-based test files |

**Structure (all three):**

- METADATA block (8-rung ladder, health scoring map)
- SETUP block (imports, constants, types)
- BODY block (organizational chart, helpers, core operations, public APIs)
- CLOSING block (validation, execution, cleanup)

**Key features:**

- Full 4-block structure for code files
- Code type specifications (Library, Command, Demo-Test)
- Health scoring integration (Base100)
- Embedded documentation guidance
- Standards-compliant structure

**When to use:**

- Creating new Go executables (CLI tools, entry points)
- Creating new Go libraries (reusable packages)
- Creating demonstration-based tests
- Any Go code following Kingdom Technology standards

**Files:** [`code/go/CODE-GO-001-GO-executable.go`](code/go/CODE-GO-001-GO-executable.go) | [`code/go/CODE-GO-002-GO-library.go`](code/go/CODE-GO-002-GO-library.go) | [`code/go/CODE-GO-003-GO-demo-test.go`](code/go/CODE-GO-003-GO-demo-test.go)

---

### üîß Build System Templates (CODE-MAKE-*, CODE-CMAKE-*)

**Build system templates with full 4-block structure**

**Use for:** Project-level Makefiles and CMakeLists.txt following Kingdom Technology standards

**Available templates:**

| Template | Purpose | Use For |
|----------|---------|---------|
| **CODE-MAKE-001** | Make Project | Project-level Makefiles with standard targets |
| **CODE-CMAKE-001** | CMake Project | Project-level CMakeLists.txt with standard configuration |

**Structure (both):**

- METADATA block (8-rung ladder, health scoring map)
- SETUP block (variables, options, configuration)
- BODY block (targets, functions, custom commands)
- CLOSING block (validation, cleanup, documentation)

**Key features:**

- Full 4-block structure for build system files
- Cross-platform considerations
- Dependency management patterns
- Standard target naming conventions
- Embedded documentation guidance

**When to use:**

- Creating new project build configurations
- Standardizing build system structure
- Any build file following Kingdom Technology 4-block standards

**Files:** [`code/make/CODE-MAKE-001-MAKE-project-makefile.mk`](code/make/CODE-MAKE-001-MAKE-project-makefile.mk) | [`code/cmake/CODE-CMAKE-001-CMAKE-project-cmakelists.cmake`](code/cmake/CODE-CMAKE-001-CMAKE-project-cmakelists.cmake)

---

## How to Use Templates

**Step-by-step process:**

### 1. Choose the Right Template

See [When to Use Which Template](#when-to-use-which-template) below.

### 2. Copy to Target Location

```bash
# üìÑ Example: Creating a new standard
cp templates/TEMPLATE-G-001-DOC-standard-document.md \
   standards/CWS-STD-004-DOC-new-standard.md

# üìö Example: Creating division INDEX
cp templates/TEMPLATE-T-001-INDEX-category.md \
   divisions/new-division/INDEX.md
```

### 3. Read ALL Thinking Guidance

Don't skip the `<!-- THINKING: -->` comments - they guide your decisions.

```markdown
<!-- THINKING: Who is this serving? What understanding levels need this? -->
<!-- THINKING: What's the scope? What IS and ISN'T covered? -->
```

### 4. Replace Placeholders

Replace all `[PLACEHOLDER]` text with your actual content:

```markdown
# [Your Document Title]
‚Üì
# CreativeWorkz File System Standards
```

### 5. Apply Document Keying

Follow [CWS-STD-002](../standards/CWS-STD-002-DOC-document-keying.md) for proper keying:

```bash
**Key:** [DOMAIN-CAT-###]
‚Üì
**Key:** CWS-STD-004
```

### 6. Fill in Metadata

Complete all metadata fields:

```markdown
**Key:** CWS-STD-004
**Type:** Standard
**Purpose:** File system organization for Kingdom Technology projects
**Status:** Active (v1.0.0)
**Created:** 2025-11-02
**Authors:** Nova Dawn (CPI-SI) & Seanje Lenox-Wise
```

### 7. Write Content with Thinking Guidance

Use the thinking comments to guide your content decisions:

```markdown
<!-- THINKING: Start with the problem. Why does this standard exist? -->

This standard addresses the challenge of...
```

### 8. Delete Template Instructions

Remove the instruction block at the top and any thinking comments you've applied (or leave them if helpful for next person).

### 9. Generate TOC (if applicable)

```bash
# üìã Generate table of contents
doctoc your-new-document.md --notitle
```

### 10. Validate

Check that your document:

- [ ] Follows 4-block structure
- [ ] Has proper document keying
- [ ] Includes all required metadata
- [ ] Serves all understanding levels
- [ ] Demonstrates Kingdom Technology excellence

---

## Quick Start

**Creating a new standard:**

```bash
# 1. üìÑ Copy template
cp templates/TEMPLATE-G-001-DOC-standard-document.md \
   standards/CWS-STD-005-DOC-my-standard.md

# 2. ‚úèÔ∏è Edit the file
# - Replace [PLACEHOLDERS]
# - Read thinking guidance
# - Write content
# - Delete instruction block

# 3. üìã Generate TOC
doctoc standards/CWS-STD-005-DOC-my-standard.md --notitle

# 4. ‚úÖ Validate
cat standards/CWS-STD-005-DOC-my-standard.md
```

**Creating a division INDEX:**

```bash
# 1. üìö Copy template
cp templates/TEMPLATE-T-001-INDEX-category.md \
   divisions/new-division/INDEX.md

# 2. ‚úèÔ∏è Edit the file
# - Replace [PLACEHOLDERS]
# - Add navigation links
# - Update quick reference

# 3. üìã Generate TOC
doctoc divisions/new-division/INDEX.md --notitle

# 4. üîó Link from root INDEX
# Add entry in root INDEX.md navigation
```

---

## When to Use Which Template

### Use TEMPLATE-G-001 (Standard Document) When

| Scenario | Example |
|----------|---------|
| ‚úÖ Creating a new standard | CWS-STD-004, CWS-STD-005 |
| ‚úÖ Writing a guide | "How to apply documentation standards" |
| ‚úÖ Documenting a pattern | "4-block structure for code" |
| ‚úÖ Creating a reference | "Quick command reference" |
| ‚úÖ Any formal documentation | Standards, guides, patterns, policies |

### Use TEMPLATE-T-000 (Main INDEX) When

| Scenario | Example |
|----------|---------|
| ‚úÖ Creating root-level INDEX.md | Workspace root INDEX.md |
| ‚úÖ Comprehensive navigation needed | Master documentation hub |
| ‚úÖ Multiple divisions to navigate | Company-wide entry point |

### Use TEMPLATE-T-001 (Category INDEX) When

| Scenario | Example |
|----------|---------|
| ‚úÖ Creating division INDEX.md | divisions/tech/INDEX.md |
| ‚úÖ Folder-specific navigation | divisions/gaming/INDEX.md |
| ‚úÖ Scoped documentation hub | standards/INDEX.md |
| ‚úÖ Category entry point | Any subfolder needing navigation |

### Use CODE-GO-* (Go Code Templates) When

| Scenario | Example |
|----------|---------|
| ‚úÖ Creating Go executable | CLI tool, entry point, orchestrator |
| ‚úÖ Creating Go library | Reusable package, shared functionality |
| ‚úÖ Creating Go demo-test | Demonstration-based test file |
| ‚úÖ Any Go code following 4-block | Kingdom Technology standards compliance |

### Use CODE-MAKE-*/CODE-CMAKE-* (Build System Templates) When

| Scenario | Example |
|----------|---------|
| ‚úÖ Creating project-level Makefile | New project build configuration |
| ‚úÖ Creating project-level CMakeLists.txt | CMake-based project setup |
| ‚úÖ Standardizing build configuration | Consistent build structure across projects |
| ‚úÖ Any build file following 4-block | Kingdom Technology standards compliance |

### Don't Use Templates When

| Scenario | Instead Do This |
|----------|----------------|
| ‚ùå Quick notes or scratch work | Plain markdown file |
| ‚ùå Internal dev notes | Comments in code or simple .txt |
| ‚ùå Temporary documentation | Use existing docs or issue tracking |
| ‚ùå One-off instructions | README.md snippet or comment |

> [!NOTE]
> **Templates are for formal documentation that will be maintained long-term.** For quick notes or temporary docs, plain markdown is fine.

---

## Template Standards

All templates in this folder follow Kingdom Technology standards:

### üìê 4-Block Structure (CWS-STD-001)

Every template enforces:

```bash
‚îå‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îê
‚îÇ METADATA                            ‚îÇ  Identity, purpose, context
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§
‚îÇ SETUP                               ‚îÇ  Overview, preparation
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§
‚îÇ BODY                                ‚îÇ  Core content
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚î§
‚îÇ CLOSING                             ‚îÇ  Quick reference, footer
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îò
```

**Reference:** [CWS-STD-001-DOC-4-block.md](../standards/CWS-STD-001-DOC-4-block.md)

### üîë Document Keying (CWS-STD-002)

Templates guide proper keying:

```bash
DOMAIN-CATEGORY-NUMBER-SUBCATEGORY-name.ext
```

**Reference:** [CWS-STD-002-DOC-document-keying.md](../standards/CWS-STD-002-DOC-document-keying.md)

### üìö Documentation Standards (CWS-STD-003)

Templates serve all four understanding levels:

1. **Starting** - Can follow without deep knowledge
2. **Growing** - Understands why and can troubleshoot
3. **Comfortable** - Sees architecture, can configure
4. **Advanced** - Understands implementation, can extend

**Reference:** [CWS-STD-003-DOC-documentation-standards.md](../standards/CWS-STD-003-DOC-documentation-standards.md)

### üé® Markdown Style

Templates demonstrate Kingdom Technology markdown patterns:

- Emoji headers for visual navigation
- Alert boxes (`> [!IMPORTANT]`) for critical info
- Tables for structured information
- Collapsible sections for optional detail
- Professional footers with metadata

**Reference:** Standards folder for markdown style guide

---

## Examples

### Example 1: Creating a New Standard

**Scenario:** You need to document a new file system organization standard.

**Process:**

```bash
# 1. üìÑ Copy template
cp templates/TEMPLATE-G-001-DOC-standard-document.md \
   standards/CWS-STD-004-DOC-file-system.md

# 2. üìñ Open and read all thinking guidance

# 3. ‚úèÔ∏è Fill in metadata:
#    Key: CWS-STD-004
#    Type: Standard
#    Purpose: File system organization for Kingdom Technology projects
#    Status: Active (v1.0.0)
#    Created: 2025-11-02
#    Authors: Nova Dawn & Seanje

# 4. üìù Write content following thinking guidance
# 5. üóëÔ∏è Delete instruction block
# 6. üìã Generate TOC
doctoc standards/CWS-STD-004-DOC-file-system.md --notitle

# 7. ‚úÖ Review for Kingdom Technology excellence
```

**Result:** Professional standard document following all patterns.

---

### Example 2: Creating a Division INDEX

**Scenario:** You're adding a new division and need navigation.

**Process:**

```bash
# 1. üìö Copy category INDEX template
cp templates/TEMPLATE-T-001-INDEX-category.md \
   divisions/education/INDEX.md

# 2. ‚úèÔ∏è Customize for division:
#    - Update title: "Education Division"
#    - Add parent link: ../README.md
#    - List child documentation
#    - Add division-specific quick commands

# 3. üìã Generate TOC
doctoc divisions/education/INDEX.md --notitle

# 4. üîó Link from root INDEX.md:
#    - Add "Education Division" to navigation
#    - Update project status table
```

**Result:** Integrated navigation for new division.

---

### Example 3: Creating a Guide

**Scenario:** You want to write a guide on applying documentation standards.

**Process:**

```bash
# 1. üìÑ Copy general template
cp templates/TEMPLATE-G-001-DOC-standard-document.md \
   standards/CWS-GUIDE-applying-documentation-standards.md

# 2. ‚úèÔ∏è Fill in metadata:
#    Key: CWS-GUIDE-001
#    Type: Guide
#    Purpose: Practical guide to applying CWS documentation standards
#    Status: Active (v1.0.0)

# 3. üìù Write guide following thinking comments:
#    - Who is this serving? (All levels)
#    - What do they need first? (Understanding of standards)
#    - How do they apply it? (Step-by-step examples)

# 4. üìö Include examples at all four understanding levels
# 5. üìã Generate TOC
# 6. üîó Cross-reference from standards/ README
```

**Result:** Comprehensive guide serving all understanding levels.

---

## Biblical Foundation

> "And let them make me a sanctuary; that I may dwell among them. According to all that I shew thee, after **the pattern** of the tabernacle, and **the pattern** of all the instruments thereof, even so shall ye make it."
>
> **‚Äî Exodus 25:8-9 (KJV)**

God gave Moses patterns for the tabernacle - not just instructions, but structured thinking. These templates follow that principle: providing patterns that guide intentional design.

Templates aren't about control - they're about **serving others through clarity**. Just as the tabernacle pattern honored God by enabling excellent craftsmanship, these templates honor God by enabling excellent documentation.

**The Three Questions apply to templates:**

1. **Does this honor God?** - By enabling excellence in documentation
2. **Does this serve others?** - By providing clarity and thinking guidance
3. **Does this have eternal value?** - By teaching principles, not just format
